The chicharr√≥n here is really good, crispy, flavorful, and definitely worth trying if you‚Äôre a fan. Unfortunately, the service takes away from the overall experience. This is about the third time I‚Äôve had a really unpleasant interaction with the lady at the register, and this time I even witnessed her being rude to a customer over the phone.

It‚Äôs disappointing, because the food really does deliver, but the negative attitude at the register leaves a bad taste. If you‚Äôre going just for the chicharr√≥n, it‚Äôs fine. But the service makes the whole visit less enjoyable. Hopefully the customer experience improves, because the food deserves better representation.

Me encanta la comida es excelente, PERO...
El servicio al cliente para contestar la llamada de los pedidos, deben de una mejora. La persona que me atendi√≥ en el d√≠a de hoy ten√≠a una r√°pidez super inc√≥moda que raya en lo poco amable y puede llevar a torpezas y equivocaciones en el pedido.
No te explica, cree que tu debes de saberte el men√∫, y hasta asumi√≥ que no quer√≠a nada porque me pareci√≥ raro que no pudiera pagar con tarjeta y me colgo. En conclusi√≥n, marqu√© tres veces para poder terminar mi pedido, luego a los pocos minutos me llam√≥ para confirmar si el acompa√±amiento era batata o tostones, lo que quiere decir que ni tom√≥ nota.

The service at this place is really poor. There's an older lady who makes it very difficult to place an order. I won't be returning, and I recommend avoiding this place at all costs unless you want your day ruined by a frustrating experience just trying to order food.

I‚Äôve heard that the food here is quite good; unfortunately, I couldn‚Äôt try it due to the incredibly poor service. I asked the older woman at the counter if they would be preparing any fresh chicharr√≥n, as the one on display looked really dry and dull. She responded that it was all they had. I had to repeat myself several times to get her to prepare me a pound of it, as she seemed more interested in the conversation happening next to her. When she asked what I wanted with the chicharr√≥n, I told her multiple times, but they still wrapped my food without the batatas. As I was telling the other lady who was ringing me up that the batatas were missing, a fresh platter of chicharr√≥n arrived. When I respectfully questioned it, the older lady serving me became very rude and insisted that I take it because she had already cut it up I walked out without my order as the service was ridiculously terrible and I felt beyond disrespected.
This isn‚Äôt the first time I‚Äôve experienced this; the older lady usually has a very negative attitude, and the service is consistently poor. I will not be returning nor would I recommend this place to anyone.
Dura dura la mejor gente buena y todo muy bueno 100%

Very popular spot in Inwood, usually has a 10-15 wait, no seating but take your food to go.

I went¬†out today with my partner¬†to Elsa La Reina¬†and we ordered two mofongos de queso and a yuca in the side.¬†They got¬†one of the mofongos¬†correct, but¬†served¬†the other¬†as a chicken mofongo¬†by error. Mistakes happen ‚Äî I understand.
The real issue was¬†how¬†I was¬†treated. When my partner¬†respectfully¬†told¬†them¬†that there was a mistake, the person¬†taking the orders began yelling at me¬†that I¬†actually¬†did¬†order¬†the chicken mofongo. It was an uncomfortable and unnecessary confrontation.
Besides¬†that, the yuca was forgotten, and I¬†waited¬†a¬†few¬†minutes¬†longer¬†for it, which would have been fine if the¬†problem¬†had been¬†solved¬†respectfully. Unfortunately,¬†nobody¬†apologized¬†‚Äî¬†neither¬†the¬†counter¬†person¬†nor¬†the cashier when I¬†was paying.
The¬†food¬†itself was fine, but the service¬†was horrible. I¬†will¬†not¬†be returning.

My last visit to Elsa La Reina del Chicharr√≥n was nothing short of amazing. Elsa truly lives up to her name the queen of chicharr√≥n! perfectly seasoned pork, and the flavor doesn‚Äôt disappoint. The chicharr√≥n was crispy, juicy, and full of that authentic saz√≥n that‚Äôs hard to find anywhere else in the city.

You can tell everything is made with love and pride. The service was friendly, fast, and made me feel like family. If you‚Äôre in New York and haven‚Äôt been to Elsa yet, you‚Äôre seriously missing out. She‚Äôs simply the best nobody does it like Elsa!

This is not the first time they give me a wrong  order .I don‚Äôt really like to make complains but some times some of them have a bad day   And treated the costumers so bad even if they are wrong .It‚Äôs sad because they make an amazing mofongo .The owner has to check what the employees do to make sure everything is running good .

I really wanted to like this place, but it was not possible. The staff were all very nice, but the food wasn't good.

The meat was dry to the bone and extremely salty. It was hard for me to eat and even harder for me to enjoy.

I don't really remember what the other dish was, but it was the opposite. It was bland and unappetizing.

It's not meant to be a dine in restaurant, but there is a table that you can sit at. It's worth mentioning that there is no air-conditioning and in front of you is a dumpster.

Estuvo bien la comida, ped√≠ la picadura para uno y ensalada de aguacate, lo compartimos dos personas y sobr√≥. El aguacate la mejor parte de todo.
El morir so√±ando la verdad no me encant√≥ y el jugo de Cherry lo sent√≠ muy dulce.

Pues les cuento que el Departamento de Salubridad cerre este negocio. Acabo de pasar caminando frente a ellos y tienen su letrero amarillo. Y todo esta cerraro. Es que esa do√±a cree que est√° en una una fonda en en campo. Agarrando las cosas con las manos. Y hablandole arriba a la comida dejandole caer saliva, en fin.

Great, unassuming place for authentic Dominican food. The portions are very large and well priced. I had the chicharron and mofongo and they were both delicious.

Massive, delicious portion of Pernil w/arroz con gandules (braised pork shoulder with a side of yellow rice and pigeon peas) and the local staple, chicharron (fried pork belly on the bone)!

Yes, I had both, dont judge until you eat here! üòú

My favorite spot every time I go to W. Heights.

This place is probably has the best Spanish food in the area. Aside from the chicharr√≥n (pork chunck) that they are known for. The rice orders with any selection of meat are going to be top tier. The flavor is spot on and the seasoning reminds me of my mothers cooking. I‚Äôm telling you order besides the chicharr√≥n and you will thank me later. Possibly the best Rabo(oxtail) in Dyckman. The best mofongo in Dyckman and the best meats. The only thing I don‚Äôt like is the servers rushing you. I know you guys wanna keep the line moving but they could come off rude at times.

This is how chicharrones are supposed to be made! The crispiest, juiciest and most flavor packed I‚Äôve had from a restaurant frankly ever! It‚Äôs quick and (not) dirty, you come in eye the golden crispy piece of pig meat and watch them weight it and hack it up, so satisfying. They have a few side options, I went with the arroz moro (which is a black rice cooked with black beans together) and say yes to the gravy. Make sure you eat it quick so the chicharrones don‚Äôt soften, mine lasted a brief car ride home (~15 min) but I couldn‚Äôt help taking a few sneak bites in the car. Get you some of the saut√©ed onions with them, delicious.
Delicioso el chicharron de cerdo, un poco costoso pero se da gusto de saborear un delicioso manjar en la gastronomia aca en NY
El mejor lugar en NY para encontrar chicharr√≥n fresco, crujiente y a un precio razonable.
Fried Sweet Potato with Chicharrones (Pork Belly) topped with Onions! Delicious!

We ordered a few lbs for our Christmas party and another time just for a lunch at work. The chicharron was amazing. It wasn‚Äôt greasy, it was meaty not just all fat. It was really crunchy even after driving all the way back to work and eating it an hour later. Some places you bite into the crackling and it sticks to your teeth. Not here just a really good crunch and crumbles apart. Will definitely be going back and grabbing some to take home.

I have lived in the area for 3 year, I have tried their food on different occasions. However, I always found their food below average. Rice and beans taste burnt. The meat is unseasoned and their best food chicharrones are average at best. What really sealed the deal, their food gave me food poisoning. I don‚Äôt want to trash the place, because the people who work there are sweet. However, the food is a main reason that I would never eat there again.
Elsa restaurant has the best spanish food in the New York City Area. You will never leave there disappointed. They are noted for their Chicharron. Their prices are very good.

This is La Isla .... All of them are different in service & consistent on flavor ... I am content for every time I go to this chain- I know what I am getting!
Their crackling is on Point ....
actually people  order multiple plates for dinner ....
Will return + highly recommended

I love their food. Amo su comida. Pero el staff muchas veces no es profesional. El cajero siempre est√° en el tel√©fono y se le olvida darme parte del pedido ya sea aguacate o soda. Si le pides algo te da actitud. No he vuelto a ir por esa raz√≥n. Que lastima que se pierdan clientes por la calidad del servicio espec√≠ficamente de ese muchacho cuando la comida es tan buena y los precios son razonables.

Brutal los chicharrones de aqui, la yuca estaba un poco dura y seca, volvi tres dias despues y lo pedi con guineitos. Pero volveria aqui todos los dias si fuera posible! Tienes refrescos dominicanos, red rock, merengue, frambuesa y todo. La verdad! Bien

Deberian de tener el lugar mas limpio, hay basura destapada en el lugar donde comen, y eso trae moscas!
Great lunch plates! The portions were larger than we were expecting- we could have shared, but it would have been hard to choose! The chicken just fell off the bone and we loved the mashed plantains!
Estes es el mejor locacion en qualida para los chicharones. Mejor del la 173. Lo unico es, no se si tienen ese liquido o sason que le ponen en la Republica Dominicana aparte.

Today 8/20/24 I was hankering for a sancocho but they only had mondongo. I bought it but I didn't receive a slices of lemon or a sliver of avocado. While paying for my order I had to wait until the man at the cashier finished using his fone. No customer service at. The MONDOGO WAS DELICIOSO.
Great tasty food. Reminds me of all my trips to Dominican Republic!
I love the Chicharron and I ate it in other Elsa but this is the best I've ever tasted I invite you to come and eat here not only chicharron but a wide variety of meals you have on a daily basis
